sentences.en: Answer a fool according to his folly.
sentences.cn: 按愚人的蠢话回答愚人.

sentences.en: Folly, folly , his heart kept saying: conscious , gratuitous, suicidal folly.
sentences.cn: 他心里不住地说着: 真蠢, 真蠢,蠢得自觉自愿, 蠢得无缘无故, 蠢得自己找死!
他总是表现出一副愚蠢的样子.

sentences.en: It is folly to buy such a junk at $ 100.
sentences.cn: 花一百美元买这样的旧化是愚蠢的.

sentences.en: It was their delight, their folly, their anodyne, their intellectual stimulant.
sentences.cn: 这是他们的人生乐趣, 他们的一时荒唐, 他们的止痛药, 他们的脑力刺激剂.

sentences.en: It's sheer folly to build nuclear power stations in a country that has dozens of earthquakes every year.
sentences.cn: 在一个每年发生几十起地震的国家建立核电站实在愚蠢。

sentences.en: Learn wisdom by the folly of others.
sentences.cn: 从别人的愚蠢行动中学到智慧.

sentences.en: Napoleon's army was sacrificed on the altar of folly in the disastrous Russian campaign.
sentences.cn: 在灾难性的俄国战役中，拿破仑的军队成了这一愚蠢之举的牺牲品。

sentences.en: Poverty and human folly magnify natural disasters.
sentences.cn: 贫困和人类的愚昧加剧了自然灾难。
有些人以干荒唐事取乐.

sentences.en: Somerville bitterly regretted his folly at becoming involved.
sentences.cn: 萨默维尔对于把自己牵涉进去的愚蠢行为后悔不迭。

sentences.en: Such a crush of finery and folly she had never seen.
sentences.cn: 她可从未见过如此华丽挥霍的盛况.

sentences.en: Such an act borders on folly.
They know that the talk of the railway going smash was folly.
sentences.cn: 她们知道那番关于铁路破产的讲话全是傻话.

sentences.en: To know it's no use , but keep on doing it -- there can be no greater folly than this.
sentences.cn: 知其不可而为之,愚不可及也.

trans.tran_en: If you say that a particular action or way of behaving is folly or a folly, you mean that it is foolish
